item.title: Persistent rubbish on pavement, 11th October
item.description:
Outside 185, 187 and 189 Plumstead common road. Looks like the flats above the shops dont have any bins? In any case, it is gross - black bin bags ripped open and all sorts just dumped on pavement. Its a health and safety risk the people living and working there need to be advised by environmental health.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Issue with wall & persistent rubbish trap, 11th October
item.description:
Think this might be 3rd time I have reported. Plumstead common road opposite 119 - a steep pavement and high wall. Rubbish everywhere including stairs and greenery. Some large metal fences total eyes sore protecting wall from falling down? Not going to work. Trapping tree debree and rubbish. Its been like this for 6 months now making ever walk to the shops depressing. Please address this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 mattresses and loads of rubbish, 11th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Ampleforth Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree outside, attracting parakeets, 11th October
item.description:
The tree outside my next door neighbour is a pest. It has lifted the pavement twice in recent times, resulting in an ugly asphalt fix and the associated cost. Additionally it isn't in keeping with other trees in the road. Now, it attracts a flock of parakeets, which are a pest, and they are making a huge mess. We shouldn't be encouraging them. It would be best for all to cut it down and start again. Additionally, the leave create a slip hazard as they create a slime on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsway, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Swing gate prevents wheelchair access, 11th October
item.description:
The swing gate circled prevents and makes difficult wheelchair access along this footway. I understand that it was installed to deter cyclists along this footway. However, I understand that there are better more inclusive methods to prevent cycling along here, and the positioning of this gate (between council estate and stretch of private housing) is not the ideal location to prevent cycling. If cycling is not permitted on these footways, there should be deterrents at the entrance points to the network of footways, not mid-way along, as when using a wheelchair you have to make a large detour when you come across this gate mid-way. There must be a better solution to prevent cycling and to allow full access along this footway for wheelchair users from Crescent Lane directly to the college please, thank you !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clapham Common South Side, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 11th October
item.description:
2nd info board has been graffitied again. Old photo from google streetview just to show location - there is different graffiti now. Info board is never used and is defunct - possibly the info board can be removed please to avoid being a canvas for graffiti ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clapham Common South Side, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
